featured.text: Familiar fables can be narrated differently or extended in interesting and humorous ways.
A culture’s folk tales, fables, songs, and proverbs are an important part of its literature.
We all have grown up with this popular version, but the 31 fable can be extended with different twists.
The end of the famous fable of “The Tortoise and the Hare” is well known to all: the tortoise wins the race against the hare.

definition.zh_def: 寓言，一種通常包含動物角色的故事，旨在傳達道德教訓。
definition.en_def: A fable is a short story, typically with animals as characters, that conveys a moral lesson.
definition.example: The tortoise and the hare is a famous fable that teaches the value of perseverance.
